meanings.definition: The process of a liquid changing to a solid or semi-solid state.
meanings.sent1: During the experiment, we observed the coagulation of the milk when rennet was added.
meanings.sent2: Blood coagulation is essential for wound healing and preventing excessive bleeding.
meanings.sent3: The coagulation of the pudding made it look like a tiny, wobbly mountain on the plate.
meanings.sent4: The coagulation of thoughts in his mind formed a solid plan for the upcoming project.
meanings.sent5: The coagulation of the lava created a new rocky island in the middle of the ocean.

meanings.definition: The action of clotting or thickening.
meanings.sent1: The coagulation of the paint made it difficult to spread evenly on the canvas.
meanings.sent2: Proper coagulation of the egg whites is crucial for a fluffy omelette.
meanings.sent3: The coagulation of the traffic at rush hour always made him late for work.
meanings.sent4: The coagulation of emotions in the room was palpable as tension rose between the two friends.
meanings.sent5: The coagulation of the sauce gave it a rich and creamy texture that complemented the dish perfectly.
